N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 710.7 - Panel members: status as public officers and removal for failure to attend meetings

State Regulations
(a) Panel members
shall be reimbursed for their actual and necessary expenses and shall be
considered public officers for the purpose of sections 17, 19 and 74 of the
POL. (b) A member who has failed to
attend three consecutive meetings of the panel to which the member has been
appointed shall be considered to have vacated their office unless the Justice

Center determines that the absences should be excused. Notice of such absences
shall be provided to the program staff and vacancies shall be filled in
accordance with article 80 of the MHL. (c) A member who has a conflict of interest
with any patient shall not serve on a panel regarding such patient. (d) A member who was unable to serve because
they have a conflict of interest shall not be deemed to have failed to attend
the hearing regarding that declaration. Notes
